### applyUpdates() {#ad89ca302de455d3971f751c8d1a5bd58}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void MemorySSAUpdater::applyUpdates (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ad36a34c7861d9ae3601c3c818d43ca2f">CFGUpdate</a> &gt; Updates, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dominatortree">DominatorTree</a> &amp; DT, bool UpdateDTFirst=false)</>}>
Apply CFG updates, analogous with the DT edge updates.

By default, the DT is assumed to be already up to date. If UpdateDTFirst is true, first update the DT with the same updates.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/memoryssaupdater-h/#l00123">123</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/memoryssaupdater-h">MemorySSAUpdater.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/memoryssaupdater-cpp/#l00794">794</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/memoryssaupdater-cpp">MemorySSAUpdater.cpp</a>.

### createMemoryAccessBefore() {#a1c21c2f4d41d5c6f6807992d60347bbd}

<MemberDefinition

Create a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memoryaccess">MemoryAccess</a> in <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memoryssa">MemorySSA</a> before an existing <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memoryaccess">MemoryAccess</a>.

### createMemoryAccessInBB() {#ab23ba05c48e8be4a29c36d83deba9146}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>MemoryAccess &#42; MemorySSAUpdater::createMemoryAccessInBB (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; I, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memoryaccess">MemoryAccess</a> &#42; Definition, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42; BB, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memoryssa/#a9773fde54683945b9e34a0f2e5c1a5a5">MemorySSA::InsertionPlace</a> Point, bool CreationMustSucceed=<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/basicaliasanalysis-cpp/#af6d5cafbdfc5313e65d990120021a3ec">true</a>)</>}>
Create a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memoryaccess">MemoryAccess</a> in <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memoryssa">MemorySSA</a> at a specified point in a block.

When used by itself, this method will only insert the new <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memoryaccess">MemoryAccess</a> into the access list, but not make any other changes, such as inserting MemoryPHI nodes, or updating users to point to the new <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memoryaccess">MemoryAccess</a>. You must specify a correct Definition in this case.

Usually, this API is instead combined with <a href="#a9ab9d33dbeb44b5ba49ab27201e6bd76">insertUse()</a> or <a href="#a21fc5eae685ef3e2dce4403a75d5ff2f">insertDef()</a>, which will perform all the necessary MSSA updates. If these APIs are used, then nullptr can be used as Definition, as the correct defining access will be automatically determined.

Note: If a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memoryaccess">MemoryAccess</a> already exists for I, this function will make it inaccessible and it <em>must</em> have removeMemoryAccess called on it.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/memoryssaupdater-h/#l00191">191</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/memoryssaupdater-h">MemorySSAUpdater.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/memoryssaupdater-cpp/#l01414">1414</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/memoryssaupdater-cpp">MemorySSAUpdater.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### insertDef() {#a21fc5eae685ef3e2dce4403a75d5ff2f}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void MemorySSAUpdater::insertDef (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorydef">MemoryDef</a> &#42; Def, bool RenameUses=false)</>}>
Insert a definition into the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memoryssa">MemorySSA</a> IR.

RenameUses will rename any use below the new def block (and any inserted phis). RenameUses should be set to true if the definition may cause new aliases for loads below it. This is not the case for hoisting or sinking or other forms of code <em>movement</em>. It <em>is</em> the case for straight code insertion. For example: store a if (foo) &#123; &#125; load a

Moving the store into the if block, and calling insertDef, does not require RenameUses. However, changing it to: store a if (foo) &#123; store b &#125; load a Where a mayalias b, <em>does</em> require RenameUses be set to true.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/memoryssaupdater-h/#l00085">85</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/memoryssaupdater-h">MemorySSAUpdater.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/memoryssaupdater-cpp/#l00307">307</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/memoryssaupdater-cpp">MemorySSAUpdater.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### removeBlocks() {#aa0c15073f16693ebc44c2410986cacec}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void MemorySSAUpdater::removeBlocks (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallsetvector">SmallSetVector</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42;, 8 &gt; &amp; DeadBlocks)</>}>
Remove all MemoryAcceses in a set of BasicBlocks about to be deleted.

Assumption we make here: all uses of deleted defs and phi must either occur in blocks about to be deleted (thus will be deleted as well), or they occur in phis that will simply lose an incoming value. Deleted blocks still have successor info, but their predecessor edges and Phi nodes may already be updated. Instructions in DeadBlocks should be deleted after this call.

### removeMemoryAccess() {#abcf78af37d56a9b72a49c65428210758}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void MemorySSAUpdater::removeMemoryAccess (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memoryaccess">MemoryAccess</a> &#42; MA, bool OptimizePhis=false)</>}>
Remove a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memoryaccess">MemoryAccess</a> from <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memoryssa">MemorySSA</a>, including updating all definitions and uses.

This should be called when a memory instruction that has a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memoryaccess">MemoryAccess</a> associated with it is erased from the program. For example, if a store or load is simply erased (not replaced), removeMemoryAccess should be called on the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memoryaccess">MemoryAccess</a> for that store/load.

### updatePhisWhenInsertingUniqueBackedgeBlock() {#a989bdd9e36b5327a04ad8db2a7014741}

<MemberDefinition

### wireOldPredecessorsToNewImmediatePredecessor() {#ae6b63bcaa1f6638b608f911cd04341e2}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void MemorySSAUpdater::wireOldPredecessorsToNewImmediatePredecessor (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42; Old, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42; New, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42; &gt; Preds, bool IdenticalEdgesWereMerged=<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/basicaliasanalysis-cpp/#af6d5cafbdfc5313e65d990120021a3ec">true</a>)</>}>
A new empty <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> (New) now branches directly to Old.

Some of Old&#39;s predecessors (Preds) are now branching to New instead of Old. If New is the only predecessor, move Old&#39;s Phi, if present, to New. Otherwise, add a new Phi in New with appropriate incoming values, and update the incoming values in Old&#39;s Phi node too, if present.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/memoryssaupdater-h/#l00168">168</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/memoryssaupdater-h">MemorySSAUpdater.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/memoryssaupdater-cpp/#l01253">1253</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/memoryssaupdater-cpp">MemorySSAUpdater.cpp</a>.

### cloneUsesAndDefs() {#acaf386b3282c97b1015397634ffa262d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void MemorySSAUpdater::cloneUsesAndDefs (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42; BB, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42; NewBB, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#abf0f52ae29f87b5e0f2b95ff961cdae1">ValueToValueMapTy</a> &amp; VMap, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a14697ded10a20f6938ae56ed208f0913">PhiToDefMap</a> &amp; MPhiMap, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function-ref">function&#95;ref</a>&lt; bool(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42;)&gt; IsInClonedRegion, bool CloneWasSimplified=false)</>}>
Clone all uses and defs from BB to NewBB given a 1:1 map of all instructions and blocks cloned, and a map of <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memoryphi">MemoryPhi</a> : Definition (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memoryaccess">MemoryAccess</a> Phi or Def).

<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="VMap">Maps old instructions to cloned instructions and old blocks to cloned blocks</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="MPhiMap, is">created in the caller of this private method, and maps existing MemoryPhis to new definitions that new MemoryAccesses must point to. These definitions may not necessarily be MemoryPhis themselves, they may be MemoryDefs. As such, the map is between MemoryPhis and MemoryAccesses, where the MemoryAccesses may be MemoryPhis or MemoryDefs and not MemoryUses.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="IsInClonedRegion">Determines whether a basic block was cloned. References to accesses outside the cloned region will not be remapped.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="CloneWasSimplified">If false, the clone was exact. Otherwise, assume that the clone involved simplifications that may have: (1) turned a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memoryuse">MemoryUse</a> into an instruction that <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memoryssa">MemorySSA</a> has no representation for, or (2) turned a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorydef">MemoryDef</a> into a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memoryuse">MemoryUse</a> or an instruction that <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memoryssa">MemorySSA</a> has no representation for. No other cases are supported.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/memoryssaupdater-h/#l00284">284</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/memoryssaupdater-h">MemorySSAUpdater.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/memoryssaupdater-cpp/#l00598">598</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/memoryssaupdater-cpp">MemorySSAUpdater.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### InsertedPHIs {#ab448c38bbad34f54708530a14d0a44f1}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>SmallVector&lt;WeakVH, 16&gt; llvm::MemorySSAUpdater::InsertedPHIs</>}>
We use <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/weakvh">WeakVH</a> rather than a costly deletion to deal with dangling pointers.

MemoryPhis are created eagerly and sometimes get zapped shortly afterwards.
